46.heading: Pictures.
46.title: Moving Pictures
46.author: Kathryn & Stuart Immonen.
notes: Summary (from publisher via SkyRiver): "Moving Pictures is the story of the awkward and dangerous relationship between curator Ila Gardner and officer Rolf Hauptmann, as they are forced by circumstances to play out their private lives in a public power struggle. The narrative unfolds along two time lines which collide with the revelation of a terrible secret, an enigmatic decision that not many would make, and the realization that sometimes the only choice left is the refusal to choose."
About an art curator and a Nazi officer in World War II Europe.

Explanatory text signed: Flodden W. Heron.
Facsimile of original title-page: Picturesque Beauties of Boswell...

118.heading: Picturing.
118.title: "Can You Picture This?"
118.author: art, Gil Evans
notes: Data from Bob Klein, Lou Mougin, Martin O'Hearn, et al. via Grand Comics Database.

119.heading: Picturing.
119.title: "I'm Trying to Picture You Wearing Knickers"
119.author: Mac.
notes: Summary: Ted says golf could open up business opportunities for Sally, and she thinks about how she'd look in golf clothes.

120.title: "Picturing Books : Southern Print Culture in Howard Cruse's Stuck Rubber Baby"
120.author: David Bordelon
120.appears_in: p. 107-122 in Crossing Boundaries in Graphic Narrative : Essays on Forms, Series and Genres (Jefferson, N.C. : McFarland & Company, 2012).

121.title: Picturing History : Palestinian Political Cartoons, 1967 to 2009
121.author: by Sadam H
notes: Thesis (Ph. D.)
University of Wisconsin-Madison. African Languages and Literature, 2013.

"This dissertation argues that Palestinian and Arab political cartoons participate in building the Palestinian nationalist project in opposition to 'the Israeli occupation' through their dissemination of patriotic feelings across deceptively simple cultural symbols. My dissertation focuses on cartoons published in two Palestinian newspapers and three neighboring Arabic newspapers. These cartoons deal with the Palestinian-Israeli conflict from the aftermath of the 1967 War until the end of the Gaza War in 2009."
Includes bibliographical references (p. 245-266).

122.heading: Picturing History.
122.title: Reading Iconotexts : from Swift to the French Revolution
122.author: Peter Wagner.
notes: (Picturing History)
Includes bibliographical references (p. 197-208) and index.
About visual literacy.

123.heading: Picturing Life Narratives.
123.title: Canadian Graphic : Picturing Life Narratives
123.author: Candida Rifkind and Linda Warley, editors.
notes: (Life Writing Series)
Includes bibliographical references and index.
A book about Canadian biographical and autobiographical comics.

124.title: Picturing Medical Progress from Pasteur to Polio : a History of Mass Media Images and Popular Attitudes in America
124.author: Bert Hansen.
notes: Includes bibliographical references (p. 271-328) and index.
Comics contents: "Popular medical history in children's comic books of the 1940s" (p. 171-203).

125.title: Picturing Pain : Toward a Visual Language of Torture in V for Vendetta and The Invisibles
125.author: Patrick Jagoda.
notes: 11 leaves ; 28 cm.
Paper presented at the Comics Arts Conference, July 20-23, 2006, San Diego, Calif.
Includes bibliographical footnotes.

126.title: Picturing the Beast : Animals, Identity, and Representation
126.author: Steve Baker ; foreword by Carol J
notes: Includes bibliographical references and index.
Summary (from OCLC) : Looks at how Western culture pictures the beast, examining how such images affect how real animals are perceived and treated.

127.title: "Picturing 'The Holiest Thing' : Joe Kubert's Children of the Warsaw Ghetto"
127.author: Samantha Baskind
127.appears_in: p. 171-184 in Visualizing Jewish Narrative : Jewish Comics and Graphic Novels (London : Bloomsbury Academic, 2016).

128.title: Picturing the Modern Amazon
128.author: edited by Joanna Frueh, Laurie Fierstein, and Judith Stein.
notes: (New Museum Books)
Exhibition held at the New Museum of Contemporary Art, March 30-July 2, 2000.
Includes bibliographical references.
Comics contents: "Female Muscularity and the Comics" p. 120-135 ; "Comments on the Comics" p. 136-149.
